snippet: Lower asset management fees and higher expenses hurt results at the brokerage firm.
abstract: Charles Schwab, hurt by lower asset management fees and higher expenses, reports first-quarter profit of $195 million, or 15 cents a share, down 20 percent from $243 million, or 20 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 1 percent to $1.19 billion.
lead_paragraph: Lower asset management fees and higher expenses hurt results at the brokerage firm.
